intro: Gendarussa sessilis, commonly known as the sessile gendarussa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
